name: Pound Cake
author: Ginny Robert
instructions:
Sift together flour, salt and nutmeg. Set aside. In large mixing bowl, beat together butter and 1 1/2 cups sugar at medium speed until light and fluffy. Add yolks all at once and beat until thoroughly blended. Gradually blend flour mixture, 3/4 cup at a time, into butter- yolk mixture. Set aside.
Wash and dry beaters. Beat egg whites and cream of tartar at high speed until foamy. Gradually add remaining 1/2 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating constantly until sugar is dissolved and whites are glossy and stand in soft peaks. Beat in vanilla. Gently but thoroughly fold egg whites into flour mixture. Pour 4 cups batter into each of two greased and floured 9 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pans. Spread evenly. Bake in preheated 325Â° oven until cake tester inserted in center comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes. Cool on wire racks 10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely.
